sentences.english: In most fields, its use has been replaced by the ‘joule’.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數領域，這個單位已經被“焦耳”取代。

sentences.english: The as-deposited sample was treated with current annealing.
sentences.chinese: 樣品採用電流退火進行焦耳熱處理。

sentences.english: Joule's work led to one of the basic laws of physical science .
sentences.chinese: 焦耳的工作引導出自然科學的一個基本定律。

sentences.english: If you go down to 1s, it's 20 MJ per mole.
sentences.chinese: 如果再往下看1s層，是一摩爾20兆焦耳。

sentences.english: At that time it wasn't called joules yet.
sentences.chinese: 不過那時候還不叫焦耳。

sentences.english: 10^-19 That is 1.6 times 10 to the minus 19 and I write joules.
By feeding the grains to livestock, we receive only 10% of the available kilojoules.
sentences.chinese: 用糧食餵養牲畜，我們只能得到10%的可用千焦耳。

sentences.english: This is 10 to the minus 18 joules for this one atom.
sentences.chinese: 對單個原子，就是10的負18次方焦耳。

sentences.english: What is the energy unit in SI? The joule.
sentences.chinese: 國際單位制中的能量單位是什麼，焦耳。

definition: electron volt (unit of energy used in particle physics, approximately 10^-19 Joules)
mega electron volt MeV (unit of energy equal to 1.6 x 10-13 Joules)
Planck's constant h, approximately equal to 6.626 x 10^-34 joule.seconds or 4.135 x 10^-15 electron volt.seconds
Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson)/Kelvin (temperature scale)
